6.23.8  Transforming arccos into arctan: acos2atan

The acos2atan command transforms any acoss in an expression to atans, using the identity

arccos(x) =
π
2
 − arctan⎛
⎜
⎜
⎜
⎜
⎝
x
√
1−x2
⎞
⎟
⎟
⎟
⎟
⎠
  • acos2atan takes one argument:
    expr, an expression containing inverse trigonometric functions.
  • acos2atan(expr) returns expr with any acoss replaced by the appropriate atans.


Example.
Input:

acos2atan(acos(x))

Output:

π 
2
−arctan⎛

⎜
